text: the engineers greatest challenge
transporting goods across some of the
steepest peaks on the planet without any
wheeled vehicles a wheel is not gonna do
any good in this terrain with all of the
steepness and the verticality you need
to carry things so the idea of actually
building the road for walkers and llama
caravans was what you saw but these are
no ordinary roads their secret lies
hidden beneath the soil and dirt black
granite stones they allow water to run
straight off the road leaving no puddles
to slip in granite walls support the
road to stop erosion and hold the slope
in place
to traverse deep cliffs they build
staircases into the mountainside linking
together more than 25,000 miles of road
forming one of the most advanced highway
networks in the world the kings of the
road with the chess Keys an elite team
of runners who carry messages from town
to town
toss keys are the Internet of the
ancient times there's a story that I've
heard that the Inka when he was here in
Machu Picchu he wanted fresh fish from
the coast every day and so this system
of roads enabled the cha skis to run
with fresh fish and get it get it to
machu picchu that's a distance of over
350 miles all on foot roads allowed the
Inca to conquer the Andes but they faced
yet another challenge how to cross the
deep valleys
